content: It feels like the customizability of the color perhaps needs to be more discoverable?

Maybe? It's not actually a thing you want to do often when there hasn't just been a design change, so I wouldn't want to make it too prominent. It's already available in 2 places (stream three-dot menu in the left sidebar, and stream settings).
Our approach to stream colors may change when we introduce stream groups, since we'll probably want to offer a stream group color configuration.
3 messages were moved here from #design > UI redesign: stream/topic header bar by Alya Abbott.

I was having the same thought as Alex -- we have it in a few places where we do stream settings, but folks clearly don't know you can change them; I don't think this is the first time we've seen folks learn you can change them only by talking to someone who works on Zulip.

I could imagine putting a color-change icon in stream recipient bars; that might prove to be much more discoverable than the places we have it now. (Or I could imagine clicking on the globe icon being a way to change it without new icons, but that feels like the kind of thing that's also possibly not very discoverable)

the UI is also a bit weird -- it seems to swap between HSL and RGB, and "confirm" gives no feedback other than sometimes swapping between the two?
